To begin a session, an app shares this object with a nearby peer using a network technology that both devices agree to. # discoveryToken

**Instance Property**

A temporary, random identifier for a device.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying var discoveryToken: NIDiscoveryToken? { get }
```

## Discussion

NI sets this property when an app initializes a session. The value of [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/discoveryToken] is unique to the session and identifies the device that created the session.

To begin a session, an app shares this object with a nearby peer using a network technology that both devices agree to. For an example that shares discovery tokens using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/MultipeerConnectivity], see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/implementing-interactions-between-users-in-close-proximity].

## Connecting to A Peer Device

- **NIDiscoveryToken**: An object that uniquely identifies a peer that participates in an interaction session.
- **run(_:)**: Starts a session with a nearby peer.
- **configuration**: The configuration run by the session.
- **delegateQueue**: The dispatch queue on which the session invokes delegate callbacks.
